Qieyun: 以開三之平?, 透開一咍平?

English: a father's elder brother; senior; elder
to increase; to brag; to bear children
honorable both in age and virtue
in order to express my congratulations
to salute by drinking; to drink the health of
the happy morning (of your birthday, vid. Ch. Q., p. 196,-3)
the age is increased by a decade (ten years)
advanced age (as that of a pine)
may your life be as long as the crane's
the star of the south pole is bright (an expression used when congratulating one on his long life, vid. Ch. Q. p. 202,-2)
may your happiness be as large as the East Sea
may your longevity be like the Southern Mountain
here means the completion of the first month of a child's age kept as a festive occasion.
to give aid towards funeral expenses
